intro: Ichnanthus mexicanus, commonly known as Mexican flameflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange-red tubular flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly rough texture. The flowers attract hummingbirds and other pollinators due to their nectar-rich structure and bright coloration.
